tech_news.title: This Tool Can Tell You If Your Home Network Has Been Compromised - Lifehacker
tech_news.description: IP Check tells you if your address is involved in malicious scanning.

tech_news.title: NotebookLM now uses Gemini 3, adds new ‘Data Tables’ output - 9to5Google
tech_news.description: NotebookLM is getting in a few more features before the holidays, including an upgrade to Gemini 3 and Data Tables.

tech_news.title: Gemini isn’t replacing Google Assistant on Android just yet - The Verge
tech_news.description: Google is pushing back its timeline for replacing Google Assistant with Gemini on Android, as it now says it will continue upgrading devices into 2026, rather than by the end of 2025.

tech_news.title: Riot Games is making an anti-cheat change that could be rough on older PCs - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: BIOS checks will only affect a limited subset of Valorant players for now.

tech_news.title: Terminator 2D: No Fate Review - Yesterday’s Battle For Tomorrow - Game Informer
tech_news.description: No Fate is a strong retro adaptation of a beloved film, but it is not without some design annoyances that we’ve moved beyond.

tech_news.title: You can now watch Stanford’s 2025 SwiftUI development lectures for free - 9to5Mac
tech_news.description: All 16 videos and supporting material from the Spring 2025 version of Stanford's CS193p course are now online, for free.

tech_news.title: Netflix is acquiring an avatar company as it moves into party games - The Verge
tech_news.description: Netflix is acquiring avatar company Ready Player Me so that users will be able to build avatars to use in Netflix’s games.

tech_news.title: Strava puts popular “Year in Sport” recap behind an $80 paywall - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: Strava’s most viral feature is suddenly locked away.

tech_news.title: We asked four AI coding agents to rebuild Minesweeper —the results were explosive - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: How do four modern LLMs do at re-creating a simple Windows gaming classic?

tech_news.title: Kojima On AI: "We Can't Go Back" - GameSpot
tech_news.description: "I think there isn't any point in saying 'We shouldn't use AI' or 'AI is useless.'"
